name: Personal Log-Day 1
description: DISASTER! As we egressed the complex, a large section of the underground tunnels collapsed behind us, leaving my team isolated from our equipment, supplies, and the rest of our personnel.

quests.name: Basic Tools
quests.description: It's like the stone age. I hope I get out of it fast.

quests.name: Basic Cooking
quests.description: It is surprising what you can do with the simplest of tools

quests.name: They don't sting
quests.description: ...these normal ones, anyway. My bee manual must've been written by a mad scientist. These little buggers can make almost anything. This is too good to overlook. Breeding without a genetics lab is tedious, though. I'll have to look into ways to expedite the process.

tasks.longDescription: This can be any species of bee, but the drones must be identical (one stack of four)

quests.name: Fast Food
quests.description: A new world, and this is where we start?

quests.name: Not Quite High Cuisine
quests.description: ...but close enough after what came before

quests.name: Food for the World
quests.description: The sleepers will need a lot of food when they wake up.

quests.name: Genetic Manipulation
quests.description: This should speed things up satisfactorily

quests.name: Scientific Genetic Manipulation
quests.description: More control than the industrial process, but also more complicated

tasks.longDescription: Gene samples required: Lifespan (shortest, longest), speed (fast, slowest), fertility (1, 4), cave dwelling (true), tolerant flyer (true), ignores day/night (true), temperature tolerance (both 2), humidity tolerance (both 2), flowering (fast), territory (large)

Required Traits: lifespan (shortest, longest), production (slowest, fast), fertility (low, maximum), cathemeral (true), cave dwelling (true), rain tolerance (true), humidity tolerance (both 2), tempature tolerance (both 2), Pollination (fast), territory (large)

quests.name: Afforesting (Industrial)
quests.description: The world is full of trees. Unfortunately, most of them aren't very useful except as a source of wood. It's time to change that.

tasks.longDescription: These are gene samples for the following species: Hill Cherry, Lemon, Grandidier's Baobad, Coast Sequoia, Rosewood, Teak, Douglas Fir

quests.name: Automated Farming
quests.description: If I never need to use a hoe again...

tasks.longDescription: I will need a planter robot, a harvester robot and a lumberjack robot, for a start
I will need a harvesting core, a chopping core, a use core and a gathering core.

quests.name: No Vegetarians Allowed
quests.description: An unpleasant business, but a time-honored tradition I do not want to dispense of.

quests.name: The Sea's Bounty
quests.description: I hate fishing. Did I say I hate fishing...

quests.name: Farming enhancements
quests.description: I have made a list of useful items that may help speed up the annoyingly slow-growing plants, and other unusual farming equipment.

quests.name: Questing Tutorial
quests.description: PLEASE READ ALL THE TEXT OF THIS QUEST CAREFULLY! This quest explains how to do quests. Scroll down to read all the text. This text area always applies to the quest as a whole. Everywhere but in this quest this is in-world flavor text. Explanations of a quest's tasks you'll find on the opposite page, Click on a task to see its text on the opposite page.

tasks.longDescription: This text area usually contains standardized text like "A task where the player has to craft specific items". If a task needs special instructions beyond that, they will appear here. This is a crafting task. Crafting these items in anything that works like a normal crafting table will count - like AE2 crafting terminals or TiC crafting stations, but autocrafting does not count. Now craft a quest delivery system. Your quest book will not be consumed in its crafting

A task where the player needs specific items. These do not have to be handed in, having them in one's inventory is enough. <== this is the standardized text. Detection tasks are used if the player must acquire specific items, but it is not possible to craft them in a crafting table. How they are acquired does not matter. If you took the quest delivery system you crafted in the previous task into your inventory, this task should already be marked completed. Detection tasks for more than one item of the same kind stay at 0% until you have the full number required in your inventory. If the quest condition is apparently fulfilled but not marked, use the "manual detect" button. If that does not work, the quest objective is not fulfilled.

A task where the player has to kill certain monsters. <== this is the standardized text. I believe this task needs no further explanation. Go kill a cow. Hint: this may prove more dangerous than you're used to.

A task where the player has to reach one or more locations. <== This is the standardized text. Go to the location specified below. In this task your goal is simply the overworld, and since you are already there, the task is marked as completed. Specific coordinates may appear in a location quest.

A task where the player can hand in items or fluids. One can also use the Quest Delivery System to submit items and fluids. <== This is the standard text. You can manually submit items to a consume task using the "Manual Submit" button below, or use the QDS. To use the QDS, select "select task" below, close the questbook and then right-click on the QDS with it. After that, you can pipe in items or fluids. Items and fluids piped into a wrong task or an unmarked QDS will be lost without benefit, so be careful.

quests.name: Afforesting (Scientific)
quests.description: The world is full of trees. Unfortunately, most of them aren't very useful except as a source of wood. It's time to change that.

tasks.longDescription: These are arborist serums (16 charges) for the following species: Hill Cherry, Lemon, Grandidier's Baobad, Coast Sequoia, Rosewood, Teak, Douglas Fir

quests.name: Somewhat More Healthy
quests.description: Pizza is unhealthy, many people don't like fish. This is for them.

quests.name: Honey for the World
quests.description: For people with a sweet tooth.
